symptom_text: Vasovagal response after administration of injection Monitored for greater than 2 hours, unable to get blood pressure to regulate Patient had to go to ER for additional IV fluids Mom was with patient in clinic- dad came after to help transport patient (family was aware it would be safer to have EMS pick patient up, and bring to hospital- family declined.)  Intervention in the clinic including  ice packs, monitoring, apple juice unfortunately patients BP was not responding appropriately, probably due to need of fluids, need IV hydration per Doctor H. Patient received vaccine, checked out and pulled into observation area for required wait period.  RN supervising observation noticed patient's husband get out of vehicle and at that time, he waved RN over.  Patient's spouse stated that she her voice sounded funny,  she was experiencing SOB and at that time he decided to administer EpiPen that they brought with them (patient has history of anaphylaxis).  RN had access to EpiPen but husband was already in process of administering Epi (he was trained and comfortable with process per his report).  Patient was trying to pull pants down to expose thigh and RN advised medication to be administered through pants.  Patient began feeling symptoms subside, other clinical staff responded and administerd 50mg Diphenhydramine.  Patient refused treatment in ED because had follow up scheduled at allergist immediately following vaccination.

Starting about 12 hours later I started feeling off, weak and achy. I wasn't able to sleep all night, sweating, aching. When I got up the next morning I had nausea all day and complete loss of appetite. My head hurt, my body was achy, and I fought throwing up all day on 4/3. When I woke up 4/4 my appetite wasn't fully there but I was feeling better. Now 4/5 and 4/6 I'm feeling normal.

Pregnant patient received the vaccine; This spontaneous prospective pregnancy case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of MATERNAL EXPOSURE DURING PREGNANCY (Pregnant patient received the vaccine) in a 25-year-old female patient (gravida 1) who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 016M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination.     Concomitant products included OXYMETAZOLINE HYDROCHLORIDE (CLARITIN ALLERGIC) for Allergy, MINERALS NOS, VITAMINS NOS (PRENATAL VITAMINS [MINERALS NOS;VITAMINS NOS]) for Pregnancy.    On 11-Feb-2021 at 6:45 AM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. The patient's last menstrual period was on 08-Oct-2020 and the estimated date of delivery was 20-Jul-2021. On 11-Feb-2021, the patient experienced MATERNAL EXPOSURE DURING PREGNANCY (Pregnant patient received the vaccine). The patient received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) beginning around the  eighteenth week of the pregnancy.  On 11-Feb-2021, MATERNAL EXPOSURE DURING PREGNANCY (Pregnant patient received the vaccine) had resolved. Sound sensitivity; Sound sensitivity evolved into ear ringing/ Eventual24/7 tinnitus; Painful jabbing sensations in right ear; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 57-year-old non-pregnant female patient received a second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: EN6207) via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 09Apr2021 (at the age of 57-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included breast cancer survivor, 2018. The patient previously received ceftin and had experienced drug allergy. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications included tamoxifen (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), vitamin d nos (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), cyanocobalamin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) and fish oil (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) for unknown indications from an unknown duration. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: EN6207) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 15Mar2021 (at the age of 57-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. On 10Apr2021, after 2nd vaccine, the patient had experienced sound sensitivity evolved into ear ringing, painful jabbing sensations in right ear to eventual 24/7 tinnitus. The events had resulted in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. No therapeutic measures were taken as a result of adverse events. The clinical outcome of the events, sound sensitivity evolved into ear ringing, painful jabbing sensations in right ear to eventual 24/7 tinnitus was not recovered at the time of report.  No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected

Starting on 1/2/2021 patient started experiencing intermittent tremors of upper /lower extremities that have been impacting on his mobility including transfers, ADLs and eating. Staff has now given the resident cups with lids to decrease spilling with meals. Provider was updated on resident's condition on 1/5/2021. On  interview on 1/6/2021 resident stated he  was feeling better, less tremor. Still felt unstable with transfers. Was able to eat and drink normally  1/6 and 1/7/2021. On exam on 1/6/2021 no tremor seen with rest or movement. In update from nursing staff 1/7/2021 no tremor noted, back to baseline. Had been on Losartan K 25 mg daily which was d/c'd 1/6/2021

Came home went to sleep till morning which is completely abnormal for me. I made it through the next two days of work feeling like I couldn't breath well but figured it was hustling with the masks on and then I woke up with the post severe pain in my chest and struggling to breath. Went to Emergency Dept. And was diagnosed with pneumonia 3 lobes and what Dr. Called what looks to be an inflammatory response in addition which may be a results of the 3rd vaccine but no data to compare. I was the first in my health system to have the 3 vaccine

sepsis; respiratory failure; Fever; Unresponsive; A spontaneous report was received from Pfizer concerning a 56-year old, female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced respiratory failure, sepsis, fever and sudden death.  The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported.    On 04 Jan 2021, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch:  unknown) for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection.  On 11 Jan 2021, the patient began to have a fever. She was sent to the emergency room for evaluation. That evening, she died. No treatment information was provided.   Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable.   The patient died on 11 Jan 2021. The cause of death was reported as respiratory failure and sepsis. Plans for an autopsy were unknown/not provided.; Reporter's Comments: This is a case of 56-year old, female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced sepsis, fever, respiratory failure and sudden death. Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time.  Further information has been requested.; Reported Cause(s) of Death: Respirtory Failure; Sepsis

Developed "mRNA Vaccine Arm" or "COVID Arm."  7 days after receiving the 1st dose, my arm became itchy near the injection site. Shortly thereafter, the area turned bright pink and started to swell.  Over the first 3 days, I treated it with ice and acetaminophen.  For days 2-5, I also treated it with an antihistamine (Benadryl).  Every day, the swelling and redness (shade) went down, and the area of the redness increased.  All symptoms has disappeared by Day 8.

she couldn't breathe; allergic reaction; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A female patient of an unspecified age received PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient called to know since the Pfizer shot is an mRNA vaccine but the Johnson and Johnson one is not, what are the chances that it would be safe for a person to switch over after an allergic reaction to the 1st dose of the Pfizer covid vaccine. The patient had an allergic reaction to the first Pfizer covid shot. She was fine until 4 hours later when she could not breathe. Had to use her rescue inhaler for asthma and took 3 puffs. It took 20 minutes for her to be able to breathe. 20 minutes afterwards, again she could not breathe again, she was arching her back trying to breathe. She took 1 Benadryl 25 mg and put Vicks vapor rub under her nose. 20 mins later that started to help. She felt like 'a fish on the sidewalk' gasping for air. She took a 2nd Benadryl. Called her primary care who sent her to an allergist. The 1st allergist refused to see her, and the other said there's nothing they can do more than her primary care could do for her. Primary care sent her back to allergist. No one wants to be responsible for her. She went to the pharmacy today to get 2nd shot, pharmacist said they do not think she could get it, and also confirmed with a 2nd pharmacist. She did not receive the 2nd dose. Outcome of the events was unknown.   Information on lot/batch number has been requested.

Attendee received second dose Pfizer vaccine at 12:35. Lot# EW0179. Attendee was directed to observation area.   At 12:50 attendee attempted to stand and started to fall, patient was able to catch her and assist her back to the seated position.  Attendee's skin was cool and clammy.  Attendee's respirations were not tachypneic or dyspneic. Attendee was then assisted to the cot to lie down, with her legs elevated.  HR:  83   BP:  106/80   RR:   16   O2Sat%:  97      12:55 - Attendee stated she felt better, no longer clammy or pale.  Sat up in the cot. 13:10 -No voiced complaints- skin warm and dry.  Took another set of vital signs before discharge without documentation.  Care Practitioner educated on home discharge/adverse reaction instructions and attendee was discharged to home with her friend. Attendee did not have any reported escalation of symptoms and was able to walk out of clinic independently.

Patient received the Janssen COVID vaccine (lot 205A21A, exp 9/21/2021) at approximately 1210. At 1219, patient reported to PHN and Paramedic that she felt lightheaded and sweaty. Patient transferred unassisted to zero-gravity chair, placed supine, and given juice. Vital signs: respirations 18l, blood pressure 150/96, pulse 88. Patient reported feeling anxious about vaccination. Patient reported allergies to penicillin, pea protein, and Diflucan. Patient takes Wellbutrin. Medical condition includes polycystic ovarian syndrome. Patient reported eating prior to vaccination. PHN encouraged patient to follow up with provider, when to call 911, and to stay for monitoring for 30min after report of symptoms. PHN offered patient Benadryl, patient declined. At 1223, patient reported no prior similar reaction. At 1230, vital signs: blood pressure 154/98, pulse 84, respirations 16. Patient reported symptoms had resolved and she wanted to leave against medical advice. PHN and Paramedic assisted patient to seated position at 1231, and monitored as patient stood without assistance at 1232. Patient continued to report symptoms had resolved. At 1232, patient left walking with steady gait.

Patient received COVID-19 vaccine on 4/18/21 at an outside facility (unknown). About 50 min after receiving vaccine, patient started with itchiness and hives on neck and behind ears, and also developed tingling on upper lip. The tingling resolved by the end of the day, but the rash persisted for several days after. Rash was managed with antihistamines.

Patient developed maculopapular uticarial rash day of vaccine that started on his lower extremities and progressed over a few days to include part of his trunk and his proximal upper extremities.  Parents gave benadryl at home. It began to self resolve 5 days after vaccine, with complete resolution on day 6 after vaccine.    Additionally, on day 5 following vaccine, the patient had one, isolated, episode of chest pain and SOB that lasted 2-3 minutes. Patient believed he was having a panic attack.  Patient's mother took BP during event which was 190/95.  Patient subsequently brought to ED where all his vitals were diffusely within normal limits including BP.  No persistent chest pain and physical exam unremarkable.  Troponin was obtained in ED and found to be elevated at 1951.  Patient was admitted, troponins were trended, and patient remained in stable condition without further adverse events, and was subsequently discharge home with diagnosis of suspected myocarditis.

Arthus reaction; arm hot to touch; swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful; Area of injection red; swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful/Arm felt sore; Inflammation; Allergic Rash; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of TYPE III IMMUNE COMPLEX MEDIATED REACTION (Arthus reaction) in a 53-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 011J20A and 030L20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below.     Concurrent medical conditions included Blood pressure high, Hyperlipidemia, Allergy (skin allergy) and Nasal allergy (nasal allergies). Concomitant products included CETIRIZINE HYDROCHLORIDE (ZYRTEC ALLERGY) for Allergy, CANDESARTAN for Blood pressure high, SIMVASTATIN for Hyperlipidemia, GLUCOSAMINE, CALCIUM and VITAMIN C [ASCORBIC ACID] for an unknown indication.   On 30-Dec-2020 at 2:00 PM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 28-Jan-2021 at 2:00 PM, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 07-Jan-2021, the patient experienced INJECTION SITE INFLAMMATION (Inflammation), DERMATITIS ALLERGIC (Allergic Rash), VACCINATION SITE ERYTHEMA (Area of injection red) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful/Arm felt sore). On 07-Jan-2021 at 10:00 AM, the patient experienced VACCINATION SITE WARMTH (arm hot to touch) and VACCINATION SITE SWELLING (swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful). On an unknown date, the patient experienced TYPE III IMMUNE COMPLEX MEDIATED REACTION (Arthus reaction) (seriousness criterion medically significant). The patient was treated with PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL) at a dose of 1 dosage form and HYDROCORTISONE at a dose of 1 dosage form. On 10-Jan-2021, VACCINATION SITE WARMTH (arm hot to touch), VACCINATION SITE ERYTHEMA (Area of injection red) and VACCINATION SITE SWELLING (swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful) had resolved. At the time of the report, TYPE III IMMUNE COMPLEX MEDIATED REACTION (Arthus reaction), INJECTION SITE INFLAMMATION (Inflammation), DERMATITIS ALLERGIC (Allergic Rash) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (swelling is 3cm around the injection site and it's more painful/Arm felt sore) outcome was unknown.      DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Skin test negative: negative (Negative) Doctor said might have been Arthus reaction..         On January 7 2021 (8 days after the first vaccine),the patient developed a red welt  hot to the touch and swollen and painful.  The reporter stated they applied ice and hydrocortisone cream with the welt lasted for three to fours days showing signs of improvement each day. The patient went to the immunologist for patch testing to ensure they were not allergic to an ingredient of the vaccines in order to schedule the second dose.  Patch testing came negative and physician concluded it could have been an Arhus reaction. The reporter stated they did not have a similar reaction with the second shot.  The patient did feel tired, had a headache and was febrile but symptoms disappeared in 24 hrs. (on 23-Jun-2021 per Source Document) Patient applied Ice to treat the described red welt and hot feeling. Patients doctor states the events Area of injection red, swollen and hot to the touch  can be due to Arthus reaction confirming by Negative patch test. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.   This case was linked to MOD-2021-233221 (Patient Link).   Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 23-Jun-2021: Significant Follow-up contains updated patient demographic details, Medical history, Lab data, Vaccine and facility information, Concomitant medication, Treatment medication, New events and Updated event outcome: Outcome of Area of injection red, swollen and hot to touch updated to recovered/resolved from Unknown. As per MA data corrections Arm felt sore event was removed.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

In the week following my vaccination, I presented no symptoms. After day 7, I developed soreness/tenderness in my left armpit and a series of neurological symptoms that are very concerning including depression, anxiety, insomnia (accompanied with heart racing, sweating, tingling in extremities, obsessive thoughts etc). Although, I have had sleep issues during the course of the pandemic, I do not deal with daily anxiety. I very rarely have to turn to any medication and especially have not had any  anxiety symptoms or sleep issues recently.   I do not believe the CDC has commented on the connection between vaccine safety and any relationship between vaccine immune response and neuropsychiatric disorders. Or how antibodies produced via vaccine react to other proteins.  My daily activities have been significantly impacted over the course of this week.  I would appreciate learning if there is possible cross-reactivity and if that has presented in other adults.

Bilirubin 16.06; Vaccine foetal exposure during pregnancy; This is an observational study case, initially received from other health professional on 02-Jan-2020, concerning a male neonate subject, whose mother was 22-year-old, pregnant subject of body weight: 207 lbs, height: 66 inches and body mass index (BMI): 33.4 enrolled in a prospective observational safety study on pregnancy outcomes in women immunized with seasonal cell culture influenza trivalent (TIVc) or quadrivalent (QIVc) vaccine during pregnancy.  The mother's medical history included obesity, bacterial vaginosis and she was positive for group B streptococcus.  The mother's concomitant medications included Prenatal vitamins (unspecified vitamins and minerals) as vitamin supplementation.   The mother did not have any previous pregnancies, nor maternal and paternal history with major congenital malformation (MCM). The mother did not consume tobacco, alcohol and illicit-drugs during pregnancy.  The mother's last menstrual period (LMP) date was 25-Mar-2019. The mother's estimated date of delivery (EDD) was 30-Dec-2019 and corrected estimated date of delivery (CEDD) was 06-Dec-2019. The type of pregnancy was singleton. The father  was 28-year-old. The pregnancy was complicated by bacterial vaginosis and the mother was treated with metronidazole vaginal gel, one applicator every day via vaginal route of administration.  On 05-Jun-2019, the subject's mother underwent first trimester screen and nuchal translucency and no MCM was noted.  On 02-Jul-2019, the subject's mother underwent second trimester screen and maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein screening (MSAFP/serum markers) and no o MCM was noted.  On 11-Jul-2019, the subject underwent anatomy ultrasound and no MCM was noted.  On 16-Sep-2019, at 25 weeks of gestation, the subject's mother was administered Flucelvax QIVc [influenza vaccine, subunit influenza virus vaccine polyvalent; batch number: 261200, dose, route of administration, anatomical location and expiration date: not reported] (explicitly coded as 'Foetal exposure during pregnancy') for influenza immunisation.   On the same day, the subject's mother was also administered co-suspect TDAP vaccine [diphtheria vaccine toxoid, pertussis vaccine acellular, tetanus vaccine toxoid; dose: 0.5 ml, route of administration: intramuscular, anatomical location, batch number and expiration date: not reported] as vaccine.  At gestational age of 40.6 weeks, the mother vaginally delivered live male neonate. The neonate birth weight was 3470 grams and no data was reported for head circumference and length. Appearance, pulse, grimace, activity and respiration (APGAR) scores at one minute was 8 and at five minutes was 9. No data was reported for APGAR score at ten minutes. No MCM was identified at birth.   On an unknown date in Dec-2019, the neonate's bilirubin was 16.06 (units were not specified) and the subject was admitted to neonate intensive care unit (NICU), but further details were provided.  The reporter did not provide causality assessment to Flucelvax QIVc.  This case is linked to case 201906276 (the corresponding mother case).  Company comment: Company comment: The patient experienced blood bilirubin abnormal associated with Flu Vaccine Cell Subunit QIV NVD. Chronology seems plausible. Reportedly, on the same day when our product was given,the subject's mother was also administered co-suspect TDAP vaccine. on an unknown date in dec-2019 the reported event of bilirubin was noted. Babies usually have their highest bilirubin level when they're 3 to 5 days old. Newborns should be watched for jaundice every 8 to 12 hours during the first 2 days of their lives. They should then be rechecked before they're 5 days old. More information about the date of ocurrance is needed. Also co-suspect vaccine may explain reported event. Causality is assessed as unlikely related for blood bilirubin abnormal and not related for foetal exposure during pregnancy per company conventions.; Sender's Comments: Company comment: The patient experienced blood bilirubin abnormal associated with Flu Vaccine Cell Subunit QIV NVD. Next day about same time of vaccination, runny nose for about three hours then gone. Feeling almost normal. Almost no pain on the harm. The day after at about ten PM feeling really tired, cold chills, Went to bed and couldn't sleep almost all night. Hot chicken veg soup helped. Couldn't never get rid of really bad headache, sore neck, extreme fatigue, foggy mind.  A few scattered and small red spots on skin. Not getting bigger nor smaller. Occasional chills but no fever 36.2 C to 37.2 C max at one point. Tingling skin and occasional numbness on hands and fingers. At one point today the hands turned white and tingly then back to normal. About 15 minutes earlier I took to baby aspirins with plenty of water. It worked on the headache but it may have been responsible for the whyte cold and tingly hands. The skin on the forearms also turned almost violet and then back to normal within about ten minutes. How long are these side effects supposed to last? I haven't been able to work. We are on day four.
Covid positive diagnosis on 7/1 /2021. No known contact with infected individual

hard; painful; hard, painful bicep "charlie horse"; itching at the injection site; chills; warm skin rash; warm skin rash below the injection site; This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of chills in a 61-year-old female patient who received Herpes zoster (Shingrix) (batch number 4RF5J, expiry date 25th April 2022) for prophylaxis.   On 8th September 2020, the patient received the 1st dose of Shingrix (intraparietal) .5 ml. On 8th September 2020, less than a day after receiving Shingrix, the patient experienced chills. On 11th September 2020, the patient experienced induration, pain localized, charley horse and injection site itching. In September 2020, the patient experienced skin warm and skin rash. The patient was treated with paracetamol (Tylenol) and camphor + diphenhydramine hydrochloride + zinc oxide (Benadryl Lotion). On 10th September 2020, the outcome of the chills was recovered/resolved. On an unknown date, the outcome of the skin warm, skin rash, induration, pain localized, charley horse and injection site itching were not recovered/not resolved.   It was unknown if the reporter considered the chills, skin warm, skin rash, induration, pain localized, charley horse and injection site itching to be related to Shingrix.  Additional details were reported as follows: On 8th Sep 2020 the patient had chills until 10th Sep 2020. 48 hours after receiving the injection, the patientg developed a warm skin rash below the injection site, this rash was still ongoing at the time of reporting.  On 11th Sep 2020, the patient developed a hard, painful bicep "charlie horse" and itching at the injection site, these symptoms were ogoing at the time of reporitng.  The patient treated these with heat, tylenol and benadryl lotion. The reported batch number 4RFSJ for Shingrix did not exist and was updated to 4RF5J as per the sales database. The reporter consented to follow up.

Patient received multiple vaccines on 7/30/19 in March 2019. Patient was admitted to Hospital 8/2-8/25/19 for new diagnosis of mixed phenotype acute leukemia (B-myeloid, Philadelphia chromosome positive, CNS 2A). He received chemotherapy with IT cytarabine on 8/23 and vincristine and daunorubicin on 8/24. He was given IT methotrexate on 8/30 and noted to have rash on neck that was initially thought to be steroid induced acne. PCR testing of the lesion was positive for VZV. He was admitted again on 9/4 for fever and neutropenia and was started on empiric therapy with acyclovir on 9/5/19. Patient has recovered from infection and all lesions are scabbed over. He has also resumed chemotherapy

At approximately 5 minutes into the 15-minute monitoring window, I became severely dizzy, flush, and light-headed while simultaneously experiencing right-sided tingling, the altered sensation from my forehead to collarbone (right side only). At approximately four hours post-vaccination my right eye had mild blurriness to my vision. The vision resolved within a few hours but the altered right-sided sensations continued for 6 days, gradually improving.  The lightheadedness and dizziness that required cool clothes and elevated feet resolved enough to stand after 30 minutes.

On 2/1 I started to feel rundown. On 2/3 I had no energy. On 2/4 I couldn't think straight. On 2/6 I got a covid test. Results negative. On 2/8 I saw a doctor who tested my electrolytes. Everything was good with labs. I was declining rapidly. I started to become very lightheaded and dizzy. I had blurred vision. I started to get migraines. On 2/11 I saw another doctor who did a bunch of tests like vertigo, said she could not figure it out. The migraines were severe and consistent. On 2/15 I went to the ER. They did a CT scan, EKG, more blood tests. She said she would diagnose me with migraines although I never had an issue with them before, and she was diagnosing me with it as a "diagnosis of exclusion". I was bedridden. I had spots in my vision and couldn't drive. I felt like I was driving drunk although completely sober so I stopped driving. I had severe brain fog. I couldn't remember what happened 2 minutes ago.  They prescribed me propranolol and a triptan. I didn't take them because I felt that the diagnosis was wrong. Something was causing migraines, my whole body was experiencing something major. On 2/19 I went to another doctor for another set of eyes. I told him what I was feeling was systemic. I had been out of work for weeks. He tested me for B12 and Magnesium deficiencies. Everything was normal. I googled nonstop. I started feeling zaps like my body needed oxygen. My brain needed oxygen. The brain fog was so severe I felt like I had dementia. I kept googling... I came across iron... I started to take iron on 2/21. I went to the VA for more blood tests. The blood tests had some low markers like eGFR and slightly low MCHC. I was clearly very sick. The same day I could barely breathe well and I went to the ER. The doctor told me he "deals with strokes and heart attacks" and not what was happening to me. I asked him to please check my ferritin. He refused. I kept taking iron. On 2/22 I went to another ER with shortness of breath and all of the other symptoms. I felt like I was going to die. I had never been so sick. I am a very healthy person who eats healthy and exercises daily. This doctor refused to test my ferritin as well. She told me it was stress. I ordered my own labs using walkinlabs.com. I had read that ferritin can be falsely elevated if the body was inflamed and I'm pretty sure that's what happened because at the time my ferritin was normal at 48. I kept taking large doses of iron (within safe limits) because my symptoms matched iron deficiency without anemia and the causes of it fit me. I read many many medical journals regarding our ferritin ranges and how ferritin should be 75+. I had never had an issue with it before. I swore it was iron. Every day 2-3 symptoms would go away.  I saw another doctor shortly after who dismissed all of my symptoms again. It was the sickest I had ever been and 4 doctors, 3 ER's all dismissed me. I was beyond frustrated and lost faith in the medical community. Some mentioned it could be the vaccine but they did not question it too much. I went to a naturopathic doctor. She did a thorough test on 3/9. My ferritin came out as a 21 on this date (after 16 days of taking large amounts of iron). She thought maybe I was already iron deficient and that when I got the shot, maybe my immune system couldn't handle both. I left it at that.  Meanwhile, another coworker, had also been out 3 weeks. He had deteriorated severely about the same amount of time after the Moderna Vaccine that I did. I didn't think much of it as he had diverticulitis. He is also a healthy eater and exerciser. Today he is still very ill. Today he told me that his Kidney doctor just found out that his Iron was completely depleted! His labs were off the charts low. Coincidence maybe, but too similar to not consider as an adverse reaction to the shot! And how many people may have the same symptoms who don't know? As of today I am still very weak and tired but I am able to work.  I don't feel as sharp. Iron did fix a lot of the symptoms but iron deficiency usually comes on slower. In this case it is like I FELL OFF OF A CLIFF. I deteriorated so hard and fast and was terrified. My family was terrified.

Guillain-Barre Syndrome Adverse Event from a flu shot for Patient. Enclosed you will find your form completed with HandOuts describing some of the questions. This syndrome has completely changed my husbands quality of life from a man who was very active, working in the yard, going to local games, attending church, visiting children and grandchildren and traveling and camping in the RV. Since this happened to him, he is unable to do very much at all except see doctors, do Physical Therapy, take medication throughout the day, and sleep a lot. Thank you in advance for wanting to know more about this syndrome and maybe there could be more explanation from doctors concerning this syndrome and recommending the flu shot or other vaccinations. If you need additional information and I can help in any way, please let me know. Patient is seen in return for GBS. He was doing better with his strength until 3 weeks ago when he had a sinus infection and a sty on the right eye. This has set him back some. He is using antibiotic eye drops for the sty. He is able to walk around the house, sometimes without a cane. He has fallen twice since his last visit, tripping on steps and then over the wheel of his wheelchair. He continues to have home PT/OT/SLP. When he sleeps at night and having a lot of vivid dreams and hallucinations. He takes Gabapentin and Tylenol PM at night. Medication and medical history lists reviewed and updated. Patient was screened for COVID 19. The patient responded no to fever, cough, travel outside of the country in the last 2 months, or exposure to someone with symptoms. Patient Follow-Up. Patient is seen after a 2.5 month absence has remained stable to improved from his GBS--he is better able to turn over in bed and to keep his trunk stable. He continues to have some falls, somewhat when he tripped over a wheel of a wheelchair but he has now gone a week without incident. "We all feel like he's come a long way." His NCS demonstrated a mixed sensorimotor axonal/demyelinating polyneuropathy with denervation on EMG in the UE and LE. No significant injury. He is receiving HHS PT and ST and OT and was recently identified as having some persistent aspiration issues and they are working on dietary manipulation at this point with ST. His pain levels occur aroune 3-4 AM from the thighs down which has been helped by higher dose of the Neurontin 300 mg QID. He uses PRN Tylenol. His pain appears to gradually be improving as well. Medication list reviewed and revised. Patient was screened for COVID 19. The patient responded no to fever, cough, travel outside of the country in the last 2 months, or exposure to someone with symptoms. There have been no new medical illnesses or new medications added. PATIENT FOLLOW UP Patient is seen in return for GBS. He is able to walk with a walker around the house and next week should graduate to a cane. He has been having sharp shooting pains in his legs throughout the day and night. This has kept him awake. He was on Gabapentin 200 mg TID, but was recently increased to 600 mg by his PCP. He has not had any falls since his last visit. Medication and medical history lists reviewed and updated. The NCV of the lower extremities showed sensiomotor polyneuropathy. PATIENT FOLLOW-UP VISIT Patient is seen in return for his difficulties with GBS diagnosed in October 29, 2019 with rapidly ascending quadriparesis with intubation for which he received 6 PLEX treatments and IVIG 0.4 gm/kg daily x 5 with minimal improvement. He was then transferred to hospital where he made slow progress, but remained non ambulatory. He was discharged 12/19 to other where he is currently an IP with discharge scheduled for tomorrow to other for additional rehab. He is ambulatory with a walker a distance of 155 feet. He continues to have issues with a stage 3 sacral decubitus requiring Wound Care. He combines both PO intake and PEG feedings to maintain protein supplies. He denies trouble swallowing--some choking on water. He denies difficulties with his UE but cannot raise his arms right < left. He denies pain. Medication list reviewed and revised. There have been no new medical illnesses or new medications added.

I received my first Pfizer COVID vaccination on 3-1-2021.  Seven days later I had a Shingles outbreak, which I've never had before.  My doctor advised that I should continue to get the second vaccination as it's a two step process, which I did on 3-25-2021.  I'm now experiencing numbness and loss of sensation that started in my foot and hand which has now progressed up my leg to my hip and from my hand up my arm.  My doctor ordered a MRI scan which showed lesions on my spinal cord.  Based on the results of the first MRI scan my doctor has ordered a second scan (showing more of the spinal cord) and a brain scan.  She has also scheduled me an appointment to speak with a Neurologist to try to determine the cause of this.  I can't help but feel that this vaccine was the cause of this as it all started shortly after I was given my first dose.

about an hour after getting the 2nd vaccine I had jaw pain to numbness in my jaw and neck.  I had my employee drive me home.  I could not work.  I took some advil and went to bed.  I woke up the next day and the numbness was gone.  About 2 weeks later my knees and ankles started hurting terrible.  I found that I could not walk, the pain was so bad.  Then I hurt my knee because I was walking funny because of the pain.  I have daily pain in my knees, ankles, fingers, and hips.  I have bought so many braces and splints, I have had an xray on the knee because I keep complaining of pain.  This weekend 5 months later I have a lump in the crease of my elbow and now have terrible forearm pain where my joints are.   I have never had any issue walking or standing and everyday I wake up it gets harder.  I never had this terrible pain and it only started after I received the second injection.

Per hospital chart notes, known timeline of events is pieced together as follows: 2021-03-23 - patient received J&J COVID-19 vaccine at Drug Store 2021-03-24 - patient developed myalgias, headache, shortness of breath, and chills - resolved within 24 hours 2021-04-02 - patient developed headache intermittent from right to left side of head for which patient was seen at an urgent care. Patient was prescribed Fioricet (butalbital/acetaminophen/caffeine). 2021-04-05 - patient developed right-sided neck pain 2021-04-06 - patient got tested for COVID-19, resulted negative on 2021-04-07 2021-04-08 - patient seen at Medical Center emergency department for headache and right-sided neck pain that shoots to (2021-04-08 cont.) the head and shoulder, for which patient self-medicated with ibuprofen. Patient reported to ED provider that using ibuprofen nearly relieves headache and makes her functional and had the most improvement the day she visited the ED prior to her visit. Patient received a CT scan of the head without contrast that was unremarkable. Patient was diagnosed with headache and neck sprain and was prescribed ibuprofen 600 mg, take 1 tablet by mouth every 8 hours, and diazepam 5 mg, take 1 tablet by mouth 3 times a day as needed for muscle spasm. 2021-04-12 - patient developed left lower extremity pain 2021-04-14 - patient followed up with Neurologist outpatient as directed by ED provider and was advised to get an MRV and left lower extremity doppler. Patient was prescribed tramadol 50 mg and butalbital/acetaminophen/caffeine (Fioricet) by the Neurologist. 2021-04-15 - patient presented to Medical Center ED before outpatient MRV and LLE doppler could be done due to worsening right-sided neck pain and inability to ambulate comfortably due to lower extremity pain that had been worsening over several days. Upon examination, there is subtle swelling to left lower extremity and doppler revealed multiple DVTs in left lower extremity. CT head without contrast was unremarkable, however, CT venogram of the brain reveals thrombi of the right transverse sinus and sigmoid sinuses, as well as IJ. Patient was initiated on argatroban and admitted to inpatient at the time of this report. "Heparin induced platelet antibody" and "lupus anticoagulant evaluation" tests are ordered and pending.

felt dizzy; felt weak; face felt weird; couldn't walk in a straight line; felt drunk and on drugs; felt shaky; bruise/bruised; couldn't use her arm for a day (couldn't move for a few days); headache; fatigue; arm had agonizing pain; felt a tight band around my thyroid; felt a tight band around my thyroid; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via a Pfizer-sponsored program. A female patient of an unspecified age received first dose BNT162B2 (BNT162B2), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included allergies such as penicillin, sulfa (have a lot of allergies), and accidental radiation leak which damage the thyroid and sometimes it created a tight band around her throat. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received a tetanus shot (arm was sore for 4-6 days). It was reported that patient was due to receive her second dose of the Pfizer vaccine next Wednesday (also reported as COVID-19 vaccine). Patient stated that weird stuff happened to her after she got the vaccine and was not sure if she could get her second dose. It was stated that immediately after getting the vaccine she walked out to the waiting room, after her first dose patient experienced that she instantly felt dizzy and needed help to sit in a chair but it didn't last too long. Patient was weak (just felt weak) and stated she waited 1.5 hours before leaving the hospital (also reported waited 1 hour and half in the waiting room) and felt a tight band around her thyroid but no difficulty breathing. It was further stated that the vaccine must have impacted her thyroid. It lasted for an hour and went way. She never felt it again. She reported that she had an accidental radiation leak which damage the thyroid and sometimes it created a tight band around her throat. Further reported that face felt weird didn't had trouble breathing, fuzzy headed and felt drunk. Patient just felt drunk and on drugs. She couldn't walk in a straight line and just felt shaky. She informed that she received a tetanus shot, her arm was sore for 4-6 days but the Pfizer vaccine was far worse. It didn't swell but she had a big bruise. Stated arm had agonizing pain, agonizing for the first 1-2 days and on third day it was gone. Patient couldn't use her arm for a day (also reported couldn't move for a few days and was bruised). Secondary felt fatigue and headache (after she got home). It was questioned if she should receive second dose. The outcome of the events felt dizzy was recovered on unspecified date (didn't last too long), felt a tight band around my thyroid was recovered on unspecified date (lasted for an hour) and arm had agonizing pain was recovered on unspecified date (third day it was gone), while unknown for the other events.  Information on the lot/ batch number has been requested.

E-coli Urinary tract infection; whelps at site; pain at site; itching at site; redness at site; Discomfort; This case was reported by a physician via call center representative and described the occurrence of escherichia urinary tract infection in a 71-year-old female patient who received Herpes zoster (Shingrix) for prophylaxis.   Co-suspect products included mepolizumab (Nucala) powder for injection for eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis.   The patient's past medical history included walking difficulty (had difficulty walking up stairs) and difficulty breathing (had breathing dificullty). Concomitant products included sertraline hydrochloride (Zoloft), omeprazole, atorvastatin, hydrochlorothiazide, amlodipine, gabapentin (Gabapentine), budesonide + formoterol fumarate (Symbicort), beclometasone dipropionate (Qvar), prednisone and mycophenolic acid (Mycophenolate).   In October 2020, the patient received the 1st dose of Shingrix. In November 2020, the patient started Nucala (subcutaneous) 300 mg cyclically. On an unknown date, the dose was changed to 300 mg cyclically. On 12th January 2021, the dose was changed to 300 mg cyclically. In November 2020, less than 2 months after receiving Shingrix, less than a week after starting Nucala and an unknown time after starting Macrobid, the patient experienced escherichia urinary tract infection (serious criteria GSK medically significant), injection site urticaria, injection site pain, injection site itching, injection site erythema and discomfort. The patient was treated with macrobid (nos) (Macrobid), ciprofloxacin (Cipro), benadryl (nos) (Benadryl) and celecoxib (Celebrex). The action taken with Nucala was unknown. On an unknown date, the outcome of the escherichia urinary tract infection, injection site urticaria, injection site pain, injection site itching, injection site erythema and discomfort were recovered/resolved.   It was unknown if the reporter considered the escherichia urinary tract infection, injection site urticaria, injection site pain, injection site itching, injection site erythema and discomfort to be related to Shingrix and Nucala.  Additional details were provifded as follows: The reporter was the patient's husband. The patient had difficulty walking up stairs and give out breath as a historical condition. The patient received 1st dose of Nucala(batch number EGPA)  in November 2020 and 1st doe of Shingrix in October 2020. The patient received all three in the office and the 300mg has been in 3 seperate shots all in lower abdomen. The reporter stated that, 12 to 24 hours after the first injection she had an E-coli urinary tract infection. The patient received Macrobidbut the urinary tract infection returned, which led to drug ineffective. Less than 2 months after vaccination with Shingrix, the patient experienced escherichia urinary tract infection, injection site urticaria, injection site pain, injection site itching and injection site erythema. The day before reporting, the patient had eosinophils level as down to 1 percent.  The patient received Cipro, Benadryl 25 mg, Celebrex 200mg as a treatment medication. The reporter stated that prior to 2nd and 3rd dose of Nucala, the patient received pre medication and had no issue with 2nd dose but had redness, itching and discomfort again but not as significant as the first time. The reporter stated that, prior to Nucala, but on a lot of other medications and inhalers, the patient's  eosinophil level was 9 to 12, at the end of December. The reporter stated that, aafter starting Nucala the patient could walk up stairs without shortness of breath and breathing had improved by 80 percent. The patient received 2nd dose of Shingrix in December 2020. The reporter consented to follow up.

Got her vaccine, went home and her son mentioned to her around 7:30 that her face looked strange.  He told her that it looked like Bell's palsy.  She didn't notice anything herself, but her son and husband noticed that something was wrong.  The next morning she got up and her face was swollen on the right side and she could then tell that something was different.  She went to work and the nurse at work suggested that she get it checked out.  She went to the doctor and they diagnosed her with Bell's palsy on Friday, 2/12/21.  The doctor told her to come back on Saturday to ensure that it didn't worsen, it did not change.  The doctor ordered a CAT scan and she had that done, and then she wanted to confer with another doctor she wanted her to get an MRI.  She got that done, and told her that she had a mini-stroke from the vaccine.  They initially put her on Prednisone thinking it was Bell's palsy.  Saturday evening she took her 2nd dose of that, but told her not to take it anymore as that was not the issue.   The doctors then said that they saw some pneumonia, and is being treated for that.  She goes back to see the doctor this afternoon.

About 3 days after the 2nd dose vaccine, I started to notice pain when moving my right shoulder.   I ignored it for a few months and have notice the pain has increased.   I did go see my doctor.   They did order an MRI.  The doctor says the muscles around the tendon is inflammed and causing my pain.  The doctor did give me epidural shots directly to my neck to help with my pain.   I am also in physical therapy which has helped.  I was also prescribed Diclofenac for the pain.   I am still having pain and weakness in my right arm  and the pain is 7/10.   There are times where I can not hold or carry heavy items.

About one minute after receiving the injection, ( approximately 9 AM) I felt my heart rate increase to about 100 bpm, and I just did not feel right.  I told the nurses I didn't feel right, and I sat down for about 10 minutes and drank 3 glasses of water.  Initially I felt better, but then I felt weak and "not right",  so I lay down on a cot for approximately 40 minutes.  My B/P was elevated (165/95), which is very high for me.  I did not have any trouble breathing.  I continued to drink water, and eventually my B/P lowered, and I felt better.  I took an antihistamine (10 mg Zyrtec) when I arrived home at 11:00 AM, and felt very tired until about 3:30 PM,  when I felt just about back to normal.  I was assessed by an ER physician at the clinic site.

Concomitant medications included HPV VACCINE VLP RL1 4V (YEAST) (GARDASIL), MENINGOCOCCAL VACCINE A/C/Y/W CONJ (DIP TOX) (MENACTRA) and DIPHTHERIA VACCINE TOXOID, PERTUSSIS VACCINE ACELLULAR, TETANUS VACCINE TOXOID (DIPHTHERIA, TETANUS AND ACELLULAR PERTUSSIS) for prophylactic vaccination. It was a case of an actual medication error due to Inappropriate age at vaccine administration and Wrong vaccine administered (latency same day). This suspected adverse reaction report is submitted and classified as a medication error solely and exclusively to ensure the marketing authorization holder's compliance with the requirements set out in Directive 2001/83/EC and Module VI of the Good Pharmacovigilance Practices. Initially after second vaccine awful migraine that resulted in trip to the ER for treatment with steroids, IV painkillers and prescription for toreador for 10 days. Beginning April 9th I had a seizure while sleeping. I mentioned this to my neurologist and she ordered and MRI (came back unremarkable) and an EEG. During the EEG which took place on May 21, 2021 when strobe lights were used I began seizing . I was transported to the ER and treated with Ativan to stop seizure. I continued seizing on and off while in the ER and was admitted to the Epilepsy monitoring unit for 4 days for observation under video monitoring and continuous EEG. I continued having seizures throughout but the EEGs did not pick up any signs of epileptic seizures. I was discharged, over the coming weeks I continued to have seizures and was started on 500mg of Keppra twice a day which was later increased to 750mg twice a day. I was also started on 25mg of lamictal the dose of which was titrated upwards to 100mg per day. Seizures typically begin with tremor in left or right leg, head pain, then facial tics, followed by full body rigidity and spasms, inability to properly breathe, clenched fists, thrashing of head, some times I would be conscious other times I would loose consciousness. Some seizures last for a minute or two while others last upawards of 20 minutes. Post seizure like activity, I am very tired, speech is unintelligible, eventually comes back with a stutter which eventually goes away after a couple of hours. The non-epileptic seizures have continued since. Hospital stays occurred on 5/21-5/25, 6/24-6/26, 7/22-7/24

Shingles; Starting to dry up; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer (patient's mother) reported for a 51-year-old male patient (reporter's son) that who received first dose of BNT162B2 (BNT162B2, solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration in Apr2021 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included the patient had covid-19 in early Jan2021 to an unknown date. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Two weeks later in 2021, the patient had shingles and now starting to dry up. Responded that you should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine if you had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if you had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The patient reported that she got her 2nd shot of the Pfizer covid vaccine on 09Apr2021. She has soreness at the site, more-so several hours after getting the vaccine (09Apr2021). There was Sore, Tired, general lethargy, and fatigue (Apr2021): when she looked online, it really only told her what everyone knows about that you might be sore and tired and she had all that, she thought she was through with all of that. She had no chills, just general lethargy and fatigue. She was sluggish and tired and not herself that weekend (Apr 2021). She stayed home so it is difficulty to say. Her arm was definitely sore. For sluggishness and fatigue, she said that she has been a couch potato for a year, it comes with the territory with lockdown and being depressed, so it is difficult to decide if it is health or physically induced or a emotional base. And on Monday (did not clarify dates but states it was Monday after 09APR2021, throughout the weekend she took it easy), she noticed with her foot, she had difficulty getting out of bed could not put weight on her right foot. She was alarmed. She stayed home and rested and did a lot of napping and taking it slow. It is still difficulty and moving certain ways hurts more if she flexes. She would wear a brace, and eventually it will get better in time. She also was wearing braces like compression socks that toes stick out of. She thought she had tendonitis and that is what she has done in the past. It has been a month and she is not better. This was her left foot, most of the pain was focused on the sole of her foot towards the outer edge. That is where it started. Then it migrated over time. That was weird and had her worried. It was all in her arch in the initial spot. She notes it is not like the tendonitis she had the first time. She does not want to be an alarmist or have her doctor think she is a hypochondriac she waited. She was then rubbing her foot, the right one, and noticed it was tender on the top of her foot just like the left one. There was sore. There was pain in right foot, pain in feet. Pain in feet, her left foot had most of the pain on the top and bottom and a lot of it is along the outer part of her sole of the foot. In her right foot, the pain is mostly at the fleshy part below her toes and on top of her foot. The night before (05May2021), the opposite leg had a line of black and blue dots on her right calf that went up her leg, she did not notice this until Wednesday (05May2021) evening because she never examines it. She soaped up a washcloth and she knew where her parts are in the bath. Her mind wanders and she was not looking. She happened to be wearing something where her legs were not covered and that is how she knew. It did not hurt. It was strange, looking like bruising in a line. The doctor said it was all like one vein and he cold feel it. She can not feel it, but he could. The doctor told her these could be clots. She still has them. Doctor said the other leg where she had the pain was only soft tissue pain. Doctor found that every place that hurt when he touched it and it still hurts where he had touched it. She was told she does not have arthritis and she has had arthritis since she was 13. The doctor did not know what it is. It was her left foot constantly, and the right foot hurt off and on during that period. The left for sure was kind of a dull ache and throbbing. The right was only a little bit. The left was worse. It appeared to be soft tissue that was hurting and he said there are so many side effects of this new vaccine and to maybe try heat or ice. Ever since the patient left doctor's office until now (the time of reporting) she did not known if she need to be concerned, that if she does not know what it is, can ice or heat make it worse? She did not know the next steps. Treatment, she tried to keep it elevated because that can not hurt but that is about it. She has not done heat and ice because if the doctor does not know what it is, how does he know it will not make it worse. He asked if she could take aspirin and she said no she is allergic to aspirin. Tylenol she does not take often, only when she feels like she needs it and she has not been doing it often. When she stays off it, it does not hurt as much as when she is walking. There was also tired, general lethargy, and fatigue. She asked if she should not worry and it will go away or should she get to a hospital. She thought she had a problem with her feet (foot problem) but her podiatrist does not know what was going on. Patient s/p second Pfizer COVID vaccine 4/17/21. Presents to ED 4/28 with slurred speech & left hemiplegia.  CT imaging revealed R MCA CVA. Patient s/p thrombectomy for CVA.  CT also had question of L transverse venous sinus thrombosis.  On 4/29, patient went for MRI which confirmed multiple anterior and posterior circulation strokes and nonocclusive left transverse dural vein thrombus.  Platelets at the time of presentation are normal.  Heparin drip initiated 4/29  after consult with hematology (patient also high bleeding risk due to HHT). IF CT head stable 4/30, Patient will be transitioned to oral anticoagulation with close monitoring by hematology given bleeding risk.

This may be a duplicate report, as primary care notes state the process has been initiated. However, out of an abundance of caution, and as the facility the event was reported to, I wanted to enter this report for completeness due to the unusual events. Patient received 1st dose of moderna covid vaccine at an outside facility and (per patient) had a seizure at that site immediately following the injection (history of seizures due to past meningitis, no seizures in past 3 months per patient). No medications were given, 911 was not called, patient not instructed to go to ED (per patient). Patient went home. Once home, patient reported "stroke like symptoms" on her right side (weakness and inability to close right eye for 30 minutes, numbness in R thigh and heel). Then weakness moved to left side (numbness/tingling in L hand and eye, numbness in L lower leg) along with some swelling to face/tongue. Had back pain but no chest pain or difficulty breathing.  Extreme dizziness. No additional seizures. The next day she called our nursing line to report these symptoms and was instructed to go to the ED and also scheduled a visit with primary care provider the next morning. Patient stated she was feeling better and apparently did not go to the ED, instead choosing to see PCP next morning. On presentation to PCP, injection site was red and swollen, itching and swelling in hands, itching in bottom of feet, widespread joint pain. No visible rash, no dysphagia, no difficulty breathing. Other symptoms had largely resolved. Patient was prescribed benadryl (no steroids due to allergy to prednisone), cold compresses for injection site and sent home with instructions to go to ED if symptoms reappeared. Also recommended making an appointment with a neurologist for additional follow up as patient currently does not see a neurologist for seizures and is treating with CBD/THC only.

Adverse Event: Severe headache (HA), chills, nausea, vomiting, lightheadedness. Slight headache began around 7pm, HA worsened in severity within an hour, chills started around 7:30pm. I then took my temperature  at home (96.5F). After getting my temperature, I took 2 Tylenol at 7:45pm, dry heaved at 8pm. My HA was refractory to Tylenol and continued to worsen. I went to the Emergency Department at Hospital where I reported pain as a 10/10.  I then vomited in the waiting room. I was brought back to a room, gave  a urine sample and gave blood for testing.  I was then given IV fluids and later given a CT scan. Test results are below in Item 19.  Treatment: IV fluids (2 bags), rest, oral hydration and food. Outcome: Within minutes of vomiting, pain went down to 4/10. With in the hour, I had fully recovered.

I administered the vaccine and the patient left the booth to sit in the waiting area.  About a minute later, someone called that he had passed out.  I found him in the chair, and his mother was holding him and trying to wake him up.  He woke up briefly but then passed out again.  She again tried to wake him up but he was still only semi-conscious.  We took his blood pressure and it and his pulse were very low.  He kept saying that he felt like he was going to pass out again.  A few minutes later we took his BP again and it was still low.  His mother and I at that point decided to call for an ambulance.  By the time they arrived, the patient was feeling better and his blood pressure had gone up slightly, so he decided not to go to the hospital.

I went to administer a flu shot and the glass ring that holds the plunger broke and cut my thumb; I went to administer a flu shot and the glass ring that holds the plunger broke and cut my thumb; This spontaneous case from  was received on 20-Oct-2020 from pharmacist via manufacturing quality assurance (product technical complaint (PTC) reference number: 1068610) and concerned a female nurse of unknown age.   The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported.     On an unknown date, the nurse went to administer Afluria Quadrivalent flu shot (influenza vaccine, dose, route of administration, anatomical location: not reported) to the patient and the glass ring that held the plunger broke (explicitly coded as 'Syringe issue') and cut her thumb. The nurse continued to give the full shot to the patient as the needle was already in his arm. The device assocated with Afluria Quadrivalent was luer lok. The batch number reported was P100257535.   The full dose was administered to the patient. There was no leakage and the vaccine were stored in the refrigerator, as reported.   The outcome of event 'laceration of thumb' was not reported.  The reporter did not provide causality assessment to Afluria Quadrivalent. The reporter assessed the events as related to device luer lok.   Quality assurance investigation (QAI) of Afluria Quadrivalent vaccine, batch number reported as P100257535, (PTC number: 1067455) determined the most probable root cause of broken finger flange on 1 syringe in Afluria_P100257535 in the 2020/2021 campaign was due to packaging equipment at the fill/finish facility. Shipping of the product was also a possible root cause for the event, as it could not be completely ruled out. Since the packaging line was the most likely root cause, the root cause had been assigned as 'Equipment Malfunction' and the complaint was justified.  Additional information received on 04-Dec-2020 from manufacturing quality assurance department: QAI provided. Reporter's information added. Narrative was amended accordingly.  Company comment: Skin laceration and syringe issue were associated with the use of Afluria Quadrivalent. Causality is assessed as unrelated for skin laceration since the injury was a result of broken glass of syringe. Syringe issue is also assessed as unrelated to Afluria Quadrivalent, per company's conventions. 'Laceration of thumb' and 'syringe broken' are assessed as related to device luer lok.; Sender's Comments: Skin laceration and syringe issue were associated with the use of Afluria Quadrivalent. Causality is assessed as unrelated for skin laceration since the injury was a result of broken glass of syringe. Syringe issue is also assessed as unrelated to Afluria Quadrivalent, per company's conventions. 'Laceration of thumb' and 'syringe broken' are assessed as related to device luer lok.

Vaccinated with vial that might have had a temperature excursion; Vaccinated with vial that might have had a temperature excursion; Vaccinated with vial that might have had a temperature excursion; A spontaneous report  was received from a nurse concerning a patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and was vaccinated with vial that might have had a temperature excursion.  The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported.   On 22 Dec 2020, the nurse reported a shipment was received. The vial arrived frozen and was placed in a freezer at recommended temperature.   On 02 Jan 2021, the freezer had failed, and the temperature alarm system did not alert anyone. It was noted that the freezer temperature at 5:50 AM was -5 degrees Celsius (C), at 7:50 AM the freezer was a 1.5 C. It remained between from 9.7 C at 12:51 PM then went to 8.3 C at 1:51 PM then down to -8.7 C at 2:51 PM.  On 03 Jan 2021 8:45 PM, the freezer returned to its normal temperature of -20.9 C, -1 C then went to 5.5 C at 11:56 PM.  On 04 Jan 2021, the temperature climbed to 19.4 C. On the same day, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 025J20-2A, 025L20A, or 027L20A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection and experienced vaccination with vial that might have had a temperature excursion  No treatment information was provided.  Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported.   The outcome of the event, vaccinated with vial that might have had a temperature excursion, was considered resolved on 04 Jan 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This report refers to a case of out of specification product use, product temperature excursion issue, and product storage error for mRNA-1273. There were no reported AEs associated with this case.

Emergency Room HPI: The patient is a 71 y.o. female with a PMH notable for COPD, hypertension and anxiety and depression who presented on 2/6/2021 for evaluation of shortness of breath. Patient presented to our emergency room yesterday morning from local nursing facility rehab nursing staff reported that she had had a increased shortness of breath for the last 3 days she has been diagnosed with COVID-19 on 2-2-2021.  Patient has also received both COVID-19 vaccines.  Patient presented to the emergency room with labored respirations conscious awake and was on a non-rebreather at 15 L. upon arrival to our emergency room patient's temperature 101.6°, pulse 169, respirations 40 to blood pressure 142/91 and oxygen saturation 100% on 15 L non-rebreather.  Patient received a chest x-ray that showed chronic emphysema and fibrotic changes in the lung no acute processes identified.  Patient's white count 12.8, glucose 197, creatinine 1.2, lactic acid 4.6, cardiac enzymes negative, D-dimer 1180, patient has urine culture pending.  Patient has received about 3 L normal saline boluses patient was having hypotension 86/52.  Patient also received IV acetaminophen a 1000 mg IV in the emergency room along with Decadron 10 mg IV piggyback.  Patient was admitted acute care for the need of IV fluids and IV antibiotics for COVID-19 and sepsis  2/12 admit Brief history and initial physical exam: Patient is a 71 year old long-term resident of Rehab and Healthcare.  Unfortunately, she contracted coronavirus (COVID-19) at the nursing home.  Her respiratory status started to decompensate and so she was brought into the hospital.  Initial workup showed significant bilateral pleural effusions and ground-glass opacity of both lungs.  She had a significant supplemental oxygen requirement.  She was admitted for further evaluation and treatment.   Hospital course: The patient was admitted and started on IV Remdesivir.  She was given IV Decadron.  She was given immune support vitamins.  Despite this, her sepsis worsened.  When it became apparent that the patient was not going to recover, her daughter did make her comfort care only and hospice was consulted.  The patient was found to be appropriate for general inpatient hospice and was made comfort care.  Her requirement for morphine and Ativan did slowly rise.  Eventually, the patient did succumb to her respiratory failure.  Time of death was called at 10:00 p.m. on February 15, 2021   Discharge Condition: expired. Presume cause of death with cardiopulmonary arrest secondary to acute respiratory failure secondary to coronavirus (COVID-19) pneumonia   Disposition: Deceased

Myasthenia gravis; double vision, cannot focus; left eye droop/right eye droop; Bell's Palsy came back with left eye droop/right eye droop; Bell's Palsy came back with left eye droop/right eye droop; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 51-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2 reported as PFIZER COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 09Mar2021 08:48 am (lot number: EN6199) as a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included facial paralysis from 20Jan2021 to an unknown date diagnosed initially as bell's palsy but now is diagnosed as myasthenia gravis and gastric reflux. Concomitant medication included unspecified gastric reflux medication and unspecified vitamins. The patient did not receive other vaccines within 4 weeks prior and did not receive other vaccine on the same day. The patient previously he was put on prednisone 60 mg tablets by mouth times 7 days, then 10 mg tablets for an additional 7 days. The patient mentioned he received the vaccine in a vaccination center. The patient reported that prior to his first shot towards the end of Jan2021, his doctor thought he had Bell's Palsy. On 20Jan2021, he stated that he was put on a high dose of steroids to clear it up. He stated that on 09Mar2021, he had his first Covid vaccine with no issues. On 12Mar2021 between 5-6 pm, he mentioned that it came back (the Bell's Palsy) with a vengeance, near his eye and with eye droop. He specifies left eye droop. He added that the Monday after (15Mar2021) over the weekend, it got worse. He mentioned that he talked with his neurologist who told him to speak with his ophthalmologist who the patient spoke to on Tuesday. The patient mentioned that both doctors came up with the diagnosis of Myasthenia Gravis. He inquired since one of his doctor's is concerned about him taking the second vaccine and the other doctor was ok with it. He mentioned that one doctor had a feeling of some bias, and the other doctor. He did some research in an association with people diagnosed with it. One of his doctors said that he is immunocompromised, so he looked at autoimmune information, and the information says it is ok. He reached out to the local medical center that is doing the vaccination and they are unwilling to talk with him over the phone. He has read on the association site and they seem to recommend to take it. He did not want to rebel against his doctor, so he wants to be sure. He inquired if it was safe for him to take his second dose and wanted to get good factual information that can give him a good starting point that is related. He mentioned that his second dose schedule was on 30Mar2021. He also stated that initial onset of Bell's Palsy with left eye droop, he was on a high dose steroid regimen and that seem to help which he finished up early Feb2021. It was mentioned that the event initial onset was not after the vaccine. The events required physician's office visit but did not require emergency room visit. He mentioned that there were 3 test and one more scheduled. The eye lid is raised more than it was before the test and it went back down. This test was done on 16Mar2021. He reported that the did a chest x-ray on 17Mar2021 and looked for enlarge thalamus, he states it was normal. He has a CT scheduled next Wednesday (24Mar2021) to check his thalamus and lungs. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test with unknown results on 17Mar2021, he reported that he is waiting for the results to look for antibodies for Myasthenia gravis; chest x-ray was normal on 17Mar2021, he reported that they did a chest x-ray and looked for enlarge thalamus, he states it was normal; endoscopy with results of no finding on Mar2021, his GI doctor wanted to do an upper and lower endoscopy, so 2 weeks prior to the vaccine he had an upper and lower endoscopy with no finding; and ice test with results of bell's palsy on 16Mar2021 and in his doctor's opinion, it didn't look right. I am now seeing a neurologist for the first time in my life that confirms I have had a autoimmune reaction to the vaccine. It?s now over 3 months and is not going away. I would like more information on why this has happened to me.

Hypertension; Tachycardia; Extreme flushing to face and neck; glowing red; took her pulse and it was 145; Persistent head to toe macular erythematous Rash; Dull Headache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient).  A 79-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscular, administered on the left arm on 21Apr2021 13:12 (Batch/Lot number was not reported; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021) as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included fibromyalgia (diagnosed more than 20 years ago), bladder cancer (diagnosed 13 years ago the first time, 8 reoccurrences and has been cancer free for 2 years, cancer free for 2 years), multi drug allergies, compromised immune status, respiratory illness, genetic /chromosomal abnormalities, endocrine abnormalities, diabetes, and obesity. Concomitant medications included lisinopril, levothyroxine, and oxazepam. No vaccines received within 2 weeks. In 12 minutes after the injection on 21Apr2021, while she was still sitting in the parking lot, patient developed tachycardia on and extreme flushing to face and neck on 13:20.  They were as red as being in the sun.  She was aware of tachycardia first.  Then she looked in the mirror and was glowing red. Patient was observing in parking lot and took her pulse and it was 145. Persistent head to toe macular erythematous rash occurred next.  They took her to the ER about 20 minutes after the injection. In the ER, she was given 25mg of Benadryl IV and 125 mg of Solumedrol IV.  When both of those wore off the next day, the generalized rash came back on Thursday (22Apr2021).  The rash was persistent but not as flushed looking as before. When they got her into ER, the first blood pressure reading was 198/117, which was within 20 minutes of injection. Hypertension was experienced on 13:30. Her blood pressure usually was fairly low and was back to normal now. She had one reading of 124/76 to 170/something. Her normal range is anywhere between 150-170/70-80's. She is on Lisinopril. The other morning when it was 124/76, was just a fluke. That was an unusually good reading. They did a regular panel of lab work when she went to the ER. They did not tell her that anything was abnormal.  She asked them to run an A1C, but they told her they could not. They did a chest film, EKG, placed IV to give medications, but no fluids given. Her doctor said not to get second dose of the vaccine.  She had it at the hospital and they had reports of other people with a rash. The patient considered the events tachycardia, extreme flushing, macular erythematous rash and hypertension were medically significant while for headache was non-serious.; Sender's Comments: The reported events were possibly causally related to the bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), due to plausible temporal relationship.  This case will be reassessed should additional information become available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Caller asking, why did this happen to me, Caller states her sister got the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine and never had any side effects except flu symptoms. Arm from her elbow to her shoulder is hot; Arm / Swollen; Arm / tender/ whole arm with sharp pain; sharp pain from her elbow up to her shoulder; sharp pain from her elbow up to her shoulder; Muscle soreness; Super tired; allergic to latex; allergic to latex; received the first shot of the Bexsero series about a year ago; This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of extremities hot feeling of in a 20-year-old female patient who received Men B NVS (Bexsero) for prophylaxis.   Previously administered products included Sulfa eye drops with an associated reaction of swelling face, Sulfa drug with an associated reaction of erythema, Benadryl and Bexsero with an associated reaction of no adverse event (1st dose received about a year ago). Concurrent medical conditions included latex allergy (contact induced such as band aids and latex gloves) and sulfonamide allergy.   On 14th October 2020 10:00, the patient received the 2nd dose of Bexsero. On 14th October 2020, less than a day after receiving Bexsero, the patient experienced extremities hot feeling of, swelling arm, pain in arm, pain in elbow, shoulder pain, muscle soreness, tiredness, allergic reaction to drug excipient, contraindicated product administered and drug dose administration interval too long. The patient was treated with ibuprofen (Advil). On an unknown date, the outcome of the extremities hot feeling of, swelling arm, pain in arm, pain in elbow and shoulder pain were recovering/resolving and the outcome of the muscle soreness was not recovered/not resolved and the outcome of the tiredness, allergic reaction to drug excipient, contraindicated product administered and drug dose administration interval too long were unknown.   It was unknown if the reporter considered the extremities hot feeling of, swelling arm, pain in arm, pain in elbow, shoulder pain, muscle soreness, tiredness and allergic reaction to drug excipient to be related to Bexsero.  Additional details were provided as follows: The case was reported by the mother of patient. The age at vaccination was not reported. The patient had latex allergy that was contact induced such as band aids and latex gloves and had sulfa allergy.  The patient had blocked tear duct and sulfa eye drops were prescribed which made her whole face red and swollen. A few years later the patient got a urinary tract infection and was prescribed sulfa as a tablet and again had a reaction to it. This time her whole body was red like a sunburn and she had to take Benadryl. The patient received Bexsero vaccine and her whole arm from her elbow to her shoulder was hot, swollen, tender, and she was experiencing muscle soreness. The patient was also super tired (took naps in the afternoon and went to bed around 9). The reporter asked if there was sulfa in this vaccine. The reporter stated that reading the page, she saw that it did contain latex. The patient was allergic to latex and sulfa drugs. The reporter stated that there should be warnings to the doctors letting them know what is in the vaccines so they do not unnecessarily harm children and young adults. There were a lot of people allergic to latex and should try your best to come up with a product that did not incorporate latex. The reporter was called back and she indicated that the patient received the Bexsero at around 10 am in the morning at the pediatrician's office. The reporter said that patient's whole arm was hot with sharp pain from her elbow up to her shoulder. It was hot and tender and swollen. On the day of reporting, in the morning the patient got up to go to school and after taking Advil. She said that her arm was just a muscle ache (no longer a sharp pain) so it seemed to be resolving. The patient did not have a fever. The reporter indicated that she was surprised that this happened because it seemed like an adverse reaction more harsh than any other vaccine the patient had ever received. The patient had received the first shot of the Bexsero series about a year ago and did not have a reaction, later than the recommended interval which led to lengthening of vaccination schedule.
