On 11-AUG-2020, the patient was vaccinated with another dose (however, she also stated it was her first dose - discrepant information) of varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX), 1 injection in the upper arm (strength, route of administration, lot number and expiry date were not reported) to boost levels. On 27-AUG-2020, the patient had a doctor's appointment and it was confirmed that she was pregnant. The patient's last menstrual period (LMP) was reported as 22-JUL-2020, estimated date of conception was calculated as 05-AUG-2020 and estimated date of delivery (EDD) was calculated as 28-APR-2021. The pregnancy outcome was pending. The fetal outcome was unknown. The relatedness between the events and the suspect vaccine was not reported.

The patient came in to get his COVID vaccine. The vaccine was administered with no abnormalities. The patient went to sit in the waiting area and fell off his chair. Pharmacy staff rushed to him to find him on the floor conscious and speaking stating he was okay. The patient was assisted to stand and get on a chair. At that point Orange Juice and Water were provided to the patient and the pharmacist sat next to him for ten minutes. Next, the patient was instructed to stay for five more minutes to make sure he was okay. The patient stated this happens to him every time he gets a vaccine and it isn't out of the ordinary at all. Patient also stated he did not eat or drink much all day besides a bag of chips and on top of that was doing strenuous work in the heat all day and this could have contributed to his collapse.

seizure; I fell of my hight; headache; total amnesia; my waking is wobbly and not steady; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 44-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection; Lot Number: ER8727) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 22Mar2021 12:30, at the age of 44-year-old, as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation.  The patient medical history was not reported. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications included vitamin c [ascorbic acid] (VITAMIN C [ASCORBIC ACID]); colecalciferol (VITAMIN D [COLECALCIFEROL]); fish oil (OMEGA 3 [FISH OIL]). On 23Mar2021, at 03:00 AM, the patient fell off his height and had a seizure. This was his first seizure in his life. The patient was rushed to the ED where a CT of the head and neck was done in Mar2021. The CT did not show any bleeding or fracture. The Neurologist dismissed the patient home and had the patient go back and see him in 2 days. The patient has been complaining of headache and taking Tylenol PRN for it. His walking was wobbly and not steady. The patient had a total amnesia of the accident. The patient did not receive treatment for seizure, fall, total amnesia and walking was wobbly and not steady. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient was not tested for COVID since the vaccination. Outcome the events was not recovered.

7-8 hours after the vaccine on (12/30/20) I started feeling tired and sluggish. Next day (12/31/20) at 9:30 am I started with body aches, chills and headache.  I got a fever of 100.2 at 4:00 pm.  I took 800mg of Ibuprofen at 4:00 pm and 9:30 pm and fever broke at 12:00 am. Next day (1/1/21) I still had a tiny headache and felt very tired.  I didn't start feeling better until Saturday (1/2/21).  On Sunday (1/3/21) I felt better and was able to go outside for some fresh air.

Within 5 minutes, I started to feel tingly all over my body, weak then shakey,  light headed then anxiety started to appear, couldn't take a deep breath, little dizzy.  I was able to walk, so I asked to see a Nurse.  I was taken to an area where I was given oxygen and rest.  My blood sugar was taken, per my request, it was (BG 160) I had eaten breakfast that morning.  I rested with oxygen for about 30 minutes, I felt an improvement, so Nurse asked to stand/walk slow...I did and got just a little dizzy, so I sat with oxygen for about another 20-25 minutes and decided to go home.  Nurse checked my oxygen level, she said it was 100% and my heart rate/pulse was 78.  I decided with the agreement of the Nurse, that I was was okay to go home and rest.  Upon arriving at home, I drank some water and rested.  My arm didn't hurt at all, until a few hours later and then for 1 day. I took a nap, when I awoke a had a slight headache, but was feeling much better, not dizzy, light headed and weakness was minimal, as well as shakiness was  minimal. Also,  a little taste at back of throat/sinus area, like a post nasal drip, kind of like when I go to the dentist. I never did take Benadryl. That strange sensation went away within the day.

Chest pain/stabbing pain on her chest wall at the right side; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 76-years-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection; Lot Number: EL9269; Expiration Date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm Left on 30Jan2021 at 11:00 (at the age of 76-year-old) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included Lupus from 1976 to an unknown date. There were no concomitant medications. Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks) reported as none. History of all previous immunization and additional vaccines administered on same date with the Pfizer vaccine reported as none. Consumer reported that she had a side effect that she had never seen listed. She had no pain or redness at the vaccine site; but about 18:00 on Sunday night she had stabbing pain on her chest wall at the right side with no other symptoms. She took an aspirin and laid down because she couldn't move with the pain. The next morning she took another aspirin and laid in bed that day. It was bad for three days. The last time she noticed that the pain was on Monday. She was thinking that she had dodged a bullet because she was not having any pain at the site. Patient stated that she had friends, (name provided) and (name provided), in their 80s, who had pain from the elbow to shoulder, she spoke with them the day after they received their shots and they got there shot at the same time and place as the patient. Patient was scheduled to receive the second dose of the vaccine on 20Feb2021. She wanted to know that the chest pain a side effect and mentioned that she was concerned about getting the next dose. On 31Jan2021, the patient experienced Chest pain/stabbing pain on her chest wall at the right side. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of chest pain and included treatment with aspirin. Patient did not required a visit to physician or Emergency room. Relevant test reported as none. The outcome of the event was recovered on 08Feb2021.  No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

A few hours after receiving vaccine I developed a headache, body aches, 102F fever, chills, very sore arm with extreme pain/swelling/heat at injection site.  This lasted for about 36 hours, gradually lessening.  I took ibuprofen 600 mg PO and tylenol (alternating), which helped.  About 48 hours after receiving vaccine I became very light headed and dizzy.   Headache became a migraine about 72 hours after injection (felt like a hormonal migraine, which I get somewhat frequently, but this was 5 days earlier than expected).  Migraine lessened after about 72 hours.  Symptoms resolved 5 days after receiving vaccine.

Left ear pain; Left jaw pain; left jaw numbness; Flu like symptoms; Severe burning in legs; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient).   This 50-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot number EA0170), on 14Apr2021 (at the age of 50-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Relevant medical history included latex allergy and hypothyroidism. Relevant concomitant medications included levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID) for hypothyroidism and ethinylestradiol, ferrous fumarate, norethisterone acetate (LO LOESTRIN FE). On 14Apr2021 at 17:00, the patient experienced severe burning in legs. On 15Apr2021, the patient experienced flu like symptoms. On 03May2021, the patient had an appointment with doctor for advice on whether to go ahead with 2nd shot as legs had been burning off and on since first shot. On 04May2021 the patient experienced left ear pain, left jaw pain and left jaw numbness. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. No therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the reported events. The clinical outcome of the events severe burning in legs, flu like symptoms, left ear pain, left jaw pain and left jaw numbness were not recovered at the time of this report.  No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Body aches and pains and fatigue  - initially - they were mild; Those lasted six days. About a month later, I noticed I was getting more migraines and experiencing more of my symptoms with fibromyalgia. For the migraines and for the fibromyalgia, they increased my Topamax and Gabapentin dosages. That helped with my headaches. And I got on different meds for the fibro -I am taking  Lyrica for the fibromyalgia now and not taking Topamax at all now. Migraines are stabilized now and the fibromyalgia is the same and it's at the point where I just have to deal with it. Pain and sometimes I get neuropathy in bot feet feet. The neuropathy is a bit better with the Lyrica. Fatigue is really bad.  Urgent Care visit somewhere in there.

2 months after my second vaccine I started to develop a series of large and painful styes in each eye. My right eye had a total of 6 and my left had 2 over the course of about a month. I saw both an eye doctor and a naturopath. I was treated with oral antibiotics, eye cleansing spray, natural remedy called CytoQuel to calm cytokines, a $575 "Tear Care" treatment to try and unclog the eye glands and countless warm compresses. At this point, my last stye started on 8/8/21 and I do not know if it is the last. I cannot wear makeup on my eyes, still need to hot compress 2x daily, stay on the CytoQuel indefinitely and my right lower eyelid is still red and inflamed no matter what we do. My eye pressures were also almost double what they were in March, the month before my first shot. In addition, JUST IN MY SMALL CIRCLE, I have found 7 other people experiencing the same thing- 6 women and 1 man, all in their 40's-50's, one will not need eye surgery to remove a stye that progressed, even with medical care, to a chillazean.

Dose administered was 0.5 ml from a vial of expired MMR. Expiration date was 12/4/2019. Patient was observed for 30 minutes plus and no adverse reactions were noted or reported by patient. Discharged at 4 pm in stable condition with instructions to return to Student Health or go to nearest Emergency Room if any adverse events occur as noted on Vis dated 8/15/19. I contact Merck - spoke with RN - reported incident. He confirmed that Merck internal data supported the potency of the vaccine under the conditions I explained to him & vaccine storage recorded. Merck Case # 01465644 was created by RN. I contacted regional director of Dept. of Health & reported the incident. As of this report, the patient has not returned to report any adverse effects. MMR Vaccine has been pulled & discarded from vaccine supplies. Procedure reviewed in house & additional staff training implemented. Patients IgG titer confirmed measles immunity from 1st dose administered in 1999. No further MMR vaccination recommended.

I got sick on July 7, fever up to 102, pounding headache, sore throat, and tired all the time, which I'm never like that. That week, I went to work Wednesday morning and had to immediately leave because of fever. I missed work on from the 7th-10th of July and did a lot of sleeping (anywhere from 14-16 hours at a time). On the 12th, I started feeling better, but I still felt tired and went back to work. Then the week of the 19th, I started having weird facial swelling. My lip would swell and go down, my eye would swell and go down, and then my lip would swell again. I broke out in hives in different parts of my body, first my back and then my stomach. The itching got worse, and the facial swelling continued. I had used no new products or changed my routine. On the 21st, I went to an urgent care for the itching. I was tested for COVID and because of my sore throat, I was also tested for strep throat, had a chemistry panel done and a liver function test. All tests were negative, but the LFT showed elevated AST levels that had doubled from the last test. On the 26th, I went to my new doctor about the hives and itching and was prescribed steroids. I finished the medication yesterday. I've had no new rashes or itching, but I did wake up with a welt this morning that eventually went away.

Woke in the middle of the night after receiving the  Covid shot to use the bathroom. I developed shingles (zoster reactivation) in the lumbar region on the left side. The presentation was back pain which preceded the rash by about 3-5 days. The zoster was radicular, in approximately the high lumbar root area, only on the left. The rash did not come fully around to the abdomen. The back pain was severe for about 1 week but not completely incapacitating.  The rash that eventually developed was classic and vesicular. I went my primary care physician just so that the diagnosis could be verified and the physician agreed that this was zoster. I am a neurologist by background and currently work in R&D at a pharmaceutical company. the time course between the vaccine administration (Jan 26 2019) and the onset of the zoster (around Mar 3 2019) was about 5-6 weeks. The zoster pain and rash resolved on its own; I did not take antiviral therapy.

Received Pfizer 2nd dose vaccine on 01/20/2021 at 7:00 AM in the patient's right arm - around 5:00 PM the same day, the patient's knees started feeling wobbly, worse on left than the right. Knees continued to swell with limited motion, discomfort on bending, no point tenderness, and a negative meniscal exam. Swelling was worse on the left. X-ray normal. Worsening symptoms continued that limited standing and walking. Labs done on 2/2/2021 came back positive for Lyme disease and reactive arthritis. Swelling initially improved when patient was put on doxycycline, but worsened significantly after physical use. MRI showed large effusion in the left knee consistent with Lyme and a small focal lateral posterior horn meniscal tear not consistent with effusion. Effusion was drained March 1st and was PCR positive for spirochetes. WBC in effusion was 3400. Patient switched to amoxicillin and knee showed improvement by March 12th, 2021.

presents to the ED via EMS in cardiac arrest. EMS report patient was in agonal respiration upon arrival and has had no pulse since 2109. Patient had a syncopal episode on the toilet prior to EMS call. EMS notes they gave patient 4 epinephrine, 1 bicarbonate, and 1 Narcan. Patient arrived with a lucas machine in place and intubated. Patient's intubation was verified to be a 7.0 ETT and 23 cm at the lip. Cardiac Activity noted in ED at 2150. See nurses notes for times medications were administered. Further history limited due to unstable vital signs. Pt hypotensive, started and maxed on levophed, epinephrine infusions and additional push dose epi given.  Right femoral central line placed.  Pt began to brady down, was given atropine, ultimately again became pulseless and CPR resumed.  After 2 further rounds of ACLS, total down time approached 1 hour without return of pulse.  On echo, there were occasional agonal beats, but no organized cardiac activity.  EKG and case had been discussed with Dr. Friday and decision was to attempt therapeutic hypothermia prior to second cardiac arrest as EKG showed inferolateral STEMI

Around 12 noon, approximately 20 hours after receiving second dose of Moderna Covid 19 vaccine I started feeling lightheaded, was unable to concentrate and felt like I was going to pass out, leg muscles became achy and rubbery feeling.  Sat down and put my head down to avoid collapsing.  Sat for about 15 minutes like this and became very warm and began sweating profusely.  Felt nauseous and had dry heaves.  Stood up and put my head down on our sink. (I was at work at the time as a retail pharmacist)  Stayed in this position about another 10 minutes.  Finally my head felt like it was starting to clear so I stood up and was able to walk around the department.  Went back to my workstation and was able to concentrate but then felt very chilled to the point where I started shaking.  This lasted about 20 minutes.  Shaking gradually stopped but then I felt very tired.  Was able to finish my shift 2 hours later, was able to drive home but felt very tired and was having muscle pain in my lower legs (thighs to ankles) and developed a mild headache.  Took one  Aleve (naproxen sodium) tablet around 4pm that afternoon.  Started feeling somewhat "normal" later in the evening around 8pm.  Woke up Sunday 3/14/21 and felt fine.

leukocytoclastic vasculitis; This is spontaneous report from a consumer (Patient) reporting for herself. A 79-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EN5318 and expiry date: May2021), first dose via an intramuscular route of administration, in Arm Right, on 14Feb2021, 10:30, as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Concomitant medication included Levothyroxine 75 mcg for thyroid, Losartan 100 mg and Metoprolol 25mg for high blood pressure. Patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks of vaccination.  It was reported that the patient experienced IGA vasculitis on 14Feb2021, at 22:00 hours and the patient was hospitalized for 11 days and the events requires the patient to visit emergency room, physician's office, also experienced small red dots on right ankle. The patient was at hospital and was getting treated by two doctors and after 5 days the doctors of the hospital were unable to treat the patient. The patient was transported via ambulance to medical center, the patient was treated by a team of doctors and specialists. She was discharged on 01Mar2021 and the rashes appears to stop spreading and no new ones has shown. The old rashes turned to bruises and the are clearing up slowly. The patient followed up with her rheumatologist after the discharger and the rheumatologist now tapering down the prednisone dosage. At the discharge were 80 mg per day and currently is at 60 mg per day, patient must drop 10 mg every 4 days until it comes reaches 20 mg. She has an appointment to visit her rheumatologist on 15Apr2021. The biopsy result from 01Mar2021 is leukocytoclastic (allergic) vasculitis. The biopsy result is IGA vasculitis. On 30-Nov-2017, the patient received the first dose of Rabipure (Inactivated Rabies Virus Vaccine, Batch number 641011E) and the first dose of co-suspect vaccine Ixiaro (Batch number JEV16D22B), both administered at an unknown dosage regimen, unknown route of administration and for an unknown indication.  On 13-Dec-2017 (13 days after the first dose- inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered), the patient received the second dose of Rabipur (Inactivated Rabies Virus Vaccine, Batch number 64111E) and first dose of Nimenrix at an unknown dosage regimen, unknown route of administration and for unknown indication.  On 12-Jan-2018, (43 days after the first dose- inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered), the patient received the third dose of Rabipur (Inactivated Rabies Virus Vaccine, Batch number 641011E) at an unknown dosage regimen, unknown route of administration and for an unknown indication.  On 19-Jan-2018, the patient received the second dose of co-suspect Ixiaro vaccine (Batch number JEV16F288) at an unknown dosage regimen, unknown route of administration and for unknown indication.  On an unknown date during Christmas Days in 2018, approximately 347 days after receiving the last dose of Rabipur and 340 days after the last dose of Ixiaro vaccinations, the patient developed cold problems with flu-like symptoms, limb pain, resting tremor of the hands *(explicitly coded as 'Tremor of hands)*, angiofibroma in the facial area *(explicitly coded as 'Angiofibroma')*, sleep disorders and migraines. seronegative autoimmune hepatitis; right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain; jaundice; intermittent low grade fever; Initial unsolicited report received from the literature on 18-Oct-2019.  Literature citation-  The following is the abstract from the article-  Acute seronegative autoimmune hepatitis is a rare entity but has been reported in the literature. Few cases have been reported where hepatitis occured after yellow fever vaccine. We present a case of acute seronegative autoimmune hepatitis (SAIH) that has probable association with yellow fever vaccine as indicated by the patient's strong history.  This case involves a 35 years old female patient who experienced seronegative autoimmune hepatitis (autoimmune hepatitis), while she received vaccine YELLOW FEVER VACCINE.  The patient's past vaccination(s) included yellow fever vaccine. The patient's past medical history, medical treatment(s) and family history were not provided.  On an unknown date, the patient received a dose of suspect YELLOW FEVER VACCINE produced by unknown manufacturer lot number not reported via unknown route in unknown administration site.  On an unknown date, the patient developed a serious right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain (abdominal pain upper), seronegative autoimmune hepatitis (autoimmune hepatitis), (Unknown latency) following the administration of YELLOW FEVER VACCINE. This event was assessed as medically significant. The patient was hospitalized for this event.  On an unknown date, the patient developed a serious jaundice and intermittent low grade fever (pyrexia) (Unknown latency) following the administration of YELLOW FEVER VACCINE. The patient was hospitalized for this event.  On an unknown date, the patient was discharge from the hospital.  Relevant laboratory test results included: Alanine aminotransferase - On an unknown date: 2189 [2189]; on an unknown date: 1146 [1146]; on an unknown date: 603 [603]; on an unknown date: 78 [78] Aspartate aminotransferase - On an unknown date: 2135 [2135]; on an unknown date: 1087 [1087]; on an unknown date: 374 [374]; on an unknown date: 67 [67] Bilirubin conjugated abnormal - On an unknown date: 1.8 [1.8]; on an unknown date: 12.5 [12.5]; on an unknown date: 10.2 Blood albumin - On an unknown date: 3.6 [3.6]; on an unknown date: 2.7 [2.7] Blood alkaline phosphatase - On an unknown date: 213 [213]; on an unknown date: 132 [132]; on an unknown date: 83 [83] Blood bilirubin - On an unknown date: 2.5 [2.5]; on an unknown date: 20.7 [20.7]; on an unknown date: 19.1; on an unknown date: 3.6 [3.6] International normalised ratio - On an unknown date: 1.3 [1.3] Platelet count - On an unknown date: 13.2 [13.2] Protein total - On an unknown date: 7.9 [7.9]; on an unknown date: 7 [7]  (Other relevant tests included CT abdomen was unremarkable for biliary system abnormalities Her viral panel (HSV, EBV, HIV, Hepatitis A-D serology) and autoimmune work-up (ANA, anti DNA, anti smooth muscle, anti mitochondrial, SSA, SSB antibodies turned) were negative. PCR for Yellow fever virus was negative as well. Liver biopsy showed severe chronic active hepatitis (grade III) without fibrosis (grade 0) but with extensive periportal necroinflammatory changes, hence, a working diagnosis of SAIH was made.)  Final diagnosis was Mild seronegative autoimmune hepatitis  The patient was treated with 1 gm METHYLPREDNISOLONE SODIUM SUCCINATE (SOLUMEDROL) and PREDNISONE (PREDNISONE) 40 mg daily. They were able to taper her steroids in the next 4 months with maintenance treatment of 5mg Prednisone.  The outcome of the event was Unknown for all the events.  Conclusion: It is concluded that given the history of this patient, the possibility of association of yellow fever vaccine inducing acute flare of autoimmune hepatitis cannot be ruled out. Further studies to unearth this rare association in detail are warranted.  Information on the batch number was requested.; Sender's Comments: This literature article concerns 35 years old female patient who experienced autoimmune hepatitis, abdominal pain upper, jaundice and pyrexia after vaccination with YELLOW FEVER VACCINE produced by unknown manufacturer. The time to onset is unknown. Lab data provided. Additional information regarding patient's past medical history, condition at the time of vaccination, other predisposing etiologies would be needed for complete assessment of the case. Based upon the reported information, the role of the vaccine cannot be assessed.

On 5/2/21, 5/5 or 6/21, and 5/8/21 during my usual/normal active/fast walking I had extreme pain and tightness across my chest, with radiating pain from my breastbone through to my back and pain down my left arm to the point of either causing me to slow my steps or stop walking completely and sit down. After 5-10 minutes the pain subsided enough to allow me to continue walking at a slower pace until I reached my destination. At the same time and continuing I had "fluttering" in what seemed to be my heart but was never confirmed so perhaps it was my breathing. This fluttering would occur after exercise or exertion and eventually I called my doctor about it and was directed to the ER at Hospital. on 5/17/21. An EKG was done which showed irregularities from one done five weeks previously.   I was given a bed and a heart monitor was attached to me.  A troponin test was done showing 60, which was up from 20 five weeks previously.  I was told this most probably indicated a heart blockage.  An ultra sound on my legs and chest area were performed with no blood clots found.  A heart catheterization was done 5/18/21.  Instead of finding arterial blockage, a Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection (SCAD) event was identified. A CT scan was performed, looking for arrhythmia's with negative results. The heart monitor data was reviewed and my heart was working normally. A baby aspirin per day was prescribed. I was discharged on 5/20/21 and have no ongoing symptoms of the SCAD event. I have no personal or family history of cardiac issues. Furthermore, the fluttering sensation I was experiencing from 5/2/21 through approximately 5/23/21, which I termed a "heart flutter" never showed up on the heart monitor data from the hospital. A pulmonologist was consulted and found no irregularities. Note: I received my first dose on 3/30/21 at 2:30pm. I received my second dose on 4/28/21 at 12:30p. The heart pain described above began just 4 days after this.

Noticed feeling extremely lethargic, heart rate increased, had grand mal seizure. Spouse said that the event was not as long or aggressive as typical grand mal episodes. Previously seizure-free for over a year and a half. Last blood lamotrigine levels tested 3/02/2021 and was out of standard range on the low end. Dosage of lamotrigine increased to compensate (225 mg AM/200 mg/PM) after obtaining results.  Dosage increased again (225 mg 2x/day) after seizure episode. Pending blood level retest in May. Event is likely due to low medicinal levels aggravated by immune response.   First pregnancy, event occurred at 30 weeks gestation. Estimated delivery 6/17/2021. Seizure occurred in bed and no physical external damage happened to the abdomen. Fetal movement is typical and predictable.
